title: Min Cost to Connect All Points
description: You are given an array points representing integer coordinates of some points on a 2D-plane, where points[i] = [xi, yi]. The cost of connecting two points [xi, yi] and [xj, yj] is the manhattan distance between them: |xi - xj| + |yi - yj|, where |val| denotes the absolute value of val. Return the minimum cost to make all points connected. All points are connected if there is exactly one simple path between any two points.

brute-force.name: Brute Force
brute-force.description: Use Prim's algorithm to find MST.

steps.instruction: Define minCostConnectPoints.
steps.hint: Use `def` to define the function.

steps.instruction: Initialize.
steps.hint: Build adjacency list with all edges (Manhattan distance). This is a dense graph.

steps.instruction: Run Prim's.
steps.hint:
Prim's algorithm: Start with node 0 in min-heap. Pop min cost edge, add to MST if not visited. Add neighbors to heap.

Example:
Points=[(0,0), (2,2), (3,10)].
Start (0,0). MinH=[(0, 0)].
Pop (0, 0). Visit {0}. Add edges: (0,1,cost 4), (0,2,cost 13).
Pop (0,1). Visit {0,1}. Cost+=4. Add edges from 1: (1,2,cost 9).
Pop (1,2). Visit {0,1,2}. Cost+=9. Total=13.

steps.instruction: Define minCostConnectPoints.
steps.hint: Use `def` to define the function.

steps.instruction: Get the total number of points 'N'.
steps.hint: We need this to build the adjacency list and control the main loop.

steps.instruction: Initialize the adjacency list with empty lists for each point.
steps.hint: Each key represents a point index.

steps.instruction: Iterate through each point 'i' to build edges.
steps.hint: We will compare each point with every other point.

steps.instruction: Extract coordinates for point 'i'.
steps.hint: Unpack the [x, y] pair.

steps.instruction: Iterate through following points 'j' to avoid duplicate edges.
steps.hint: Starting from 'i + 1' ensures we only calculate the distance between pairs once.

steps.instruction: Extract coordinates for point 'j'.
steps.hint: Unpack the second [x, y] pair.

steps.instruction: Calculate the Manhattan distance between point 'i' and point 'j'.
steps.hint: Formula: |x1 - x2| + |y1 - y2|.

steps.instruction: Add the edge from 'i' to 'j' in the adjacency list.
steps.hint: Store the cost first so it's easier to use with a heap later.

steps.instruction: Add the symmetrical edge from 'j' to 'i'.
steps.hint: The graph is undirected; the cost is the same in both directions.

steps.instruction: Initialize the total cost 'res' to 0.
steps.hint: This will store the sum of all Manhattan distances in our MST.

steps.instruction: Initialize an empty set 'visit' to track connected points.
steps.hint: A set allows for O(1) average time complexity for lookups.

steps.instruction: Initialize the min-heap with a starting edge: [cost 0, point index 0].
steps.hint: We start from the first point (index 0) with a cost of 0 to include it.

steps.instruction: Start a loop that continues until all 'N' points are visited.
steps.hint: The MST for N points will have exactly N nodes and N-1 edges.

steps.instruction: Pop the edge with the minimum cost from the heap.
steps.hint: The heap always gives us the shortest available edge connecting to our current MST.

steps.instruction: If the point 'i' is already in 'visit', skip to the next iteration.
steps.hint: This avoids forming cycles or re-visiting points.

steps.instruction: Continue the loop if the point was skipped.
steps.hint: The 'continue' keyword skips the rest of the current loop iteration.

steps.instruction: Add the cost of the current edge to the total result.
steps.hint: The cost represents the Manhattan distance to this new point.

steps.instruction: Mark the point 'i' as visited.
steps.hint: Adding it to the set prevents us from taking other (more expensive) edges to this same point.

steps.instruction: Iterate through every neighbor 'nei' of the current point.
steps.hint: We are looking for new potential edges to points not yet in our MST.

steps.instruction: Check if the neighbor 'nei' has not been visited yet.
steps.hint: We only care about neighbors that are still outside our connected component.

steps.instruction: Push the neighbor's cost and index into the min-heap.
steps.hint: This adds a new candidate edge to our heap.

steps.instruction: Return the final total cost 'res'.
steps.hint: Once the loop finishes, we have connected all points with minimum total cost.
